intro: Trichocline plicata, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It produces showy, pale yellow to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Trichocline plicata is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine regions.
